definitions: Grasp, carry, or support with one's hands or arms.
Keep or detain (someone) in a particular place.
Organize and conduct (a meeting, election, or celebration).
Believe or adhere to (an opinion or belief).
examples: She can hold her breath for a long time.
The police will hold the suspect overnight.
They will hold a conference next month.
The old bridge might not hold much longer.
He holds a strong belief in justice.
